page.title: 03Industry
page.content: The only industry which remains active in these valleys is agriculture. There are many small farms who keep the local Herdwick sheep on the fells and benefit from the hill farms subsidies supplied by the E.E.C. Some of the farms also keep store cattle for fattening through the winter. They and the sheep are sustained through the winter by silage and hay harvested of the lower pastures during the summer. There are a few dairy farms also operating. Most livestock is taken to Broughton market (2\ miles away) or to the much larger market at Ulverston (12 miles). Lately there has been an interest in tourism but this is very small and is limited to a few farms offering bed and breakfast accomodation.
